descriptions.overview: Easy to use saw with power for cutting and ripping look no further than Hitachi's C7SB3. This circular saw is lightweight at only 9.5 lbs. but has a powerful 6000 no load RPM 15 Amp motor. The base is a heavy-duty one piece die-cast aluminum alloy with scales on the front and side for accurate cuts. An easy access bevel adjustment lever allows for 0° to 55° bevel cuts. The non-slip, soft comfort handle paired with the above features make for easier extended use.
list: Easy access bevel angle and cutting depth adjustment
Non-slip, slim grip : for superior control and comfort during use to reduce user fatigue
Heavy duty aluminum base with scales on front and side for accurate cuts
Dust blower- to clear work area for clearer line of sight

reviews.title: "Solid Worker Well Calibrated"
reviews.text:
This saw appears to be a solid workhorse. Compared it to my old standard (Craftsman Industrial); see photo. This saw is a full 3 pounds lighter (10.0 for the Hitachi vs. 13.1 for the Craftsman), plus adds in a couple amps (15 vs. 13) of power.

Tested out a crosscut, and it's dead on the cut line tracking with the saw base notch. Also did a 45 degree miter, and it too was accurate compared to my square. Only minor squawk is that the cord is a bit short (six feet vs. nine). Also would have been nice to have the included 24T blade already loaded, but that was easily fixed. I like the hex key vs. socket wrench approach to clamping the blade. Last little nit is that the plug does not have a notch to clamp on the cord, but overall an outstanding saw that should get plenty of use.

reviews.title: "Great Features"

The rip guide is an option, so pick one up when you buy saw if you use one.
Saw is well built. I really like it. Grips are very user friendly.
I like the five year warranty!
reviews.author: Sandy

reviews.title: "Good Saw"
reviews.text: This saw cuts through wood like butter. There's plenty of power and doesn't bog down when going through wood at a faster pace. It has no problem keeping up with me. The only issue I have (why I gave it 4 stars) is the saw did not come with the wing nut and spring for a guide rail. I knew the saw didn't come with the guide rail and I figured I'd purchase an aftermarket one. But there was nothing to secure the rail, so I had to jump through a bunch of hoops and order the proper wing nut and spring from Hitachi. Hitachi needs to include that piece. Otherwise the saw itself is outstanding.

reviews.title: "Well-built saw, with convenient features, but nothing gimmicky"
reviews.text: This is a great saw. It is well balanced and low profile (not top-heavy at all). The grips are very comfortable, and the trigger has a great, solid, smooth, built-to-last feel. The blade guard is extremely smooth; I can't feel it moving when I enter the wood even if I try.The foot is 1/16" thick: plenty strong. The plastic housing is very high quality molded plastic (I think). It actually almost looks like fiberglass, but it's not. The blade guard is metal, I'm not sure what kind, but it is plenty strong enough. Not that I would recommend it, but this saw feels like it could be dropped a good deal, and not suffer much damage.Now for the features. It has the externally accessible carbon brushes (the next-best thing to brushless, without the price). The Dust blower really does help a lot with being able to see the line on long cuts. I wasn't sure about the spindle lock, because I had one break on me once, and then it was a real pain to get the blade off, but I don't think that this one will break. The bevel adjusters are very nice, large levers that are easy to use, but don't really get in the way. Get the case with it if you can: it is really well designed, and will protect the saw well. It fits nice and snugly.All in all, a great saw, with sturdy durability, convenient features, and at a low price.

questions.question: "Does it come with battery and charger?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Hitachi Power Tools USA
answers.text: No, the C7SB3 7-1/4" circular saw is a corded tool. If you are looking for a cordless Hitachi circular saw- try models C18DBALP4, C18DGLP4 or C18DSLP4. Our cordless circular saws are sold without battery and charger, but our everyday low battery pricing makes it very easy to purchase what is needed for your application. Or, if you already have Hitachi slide type batteries- then it will work in our cordless tools.
